text:
Want to advance your inbound marketing/demand gen approach? I recently chatted with the folks of The Industrial Marketing Show about just that. Shared some examples of how we did it at ERIKS.

Would love to hear your thoughts

My key learnings from the past year:
• Always start with goals (as close to revenue as possible)
• Set those goals together with your sales team and involve them throughout a campaign
• Stop looking at pageviews and rankings, as marketing, you own revenue and brand
• Get an early success on the board, it will make life 10x easier
• Strategy and execution go hand-in-hand, without strategy you're running a marathon without knowing where the course and the finish line are. And strategy without execution (aka good processes) is like running a marathon with concrete blocks and barbed wire around every corner
• Support your sales team, especially if inbound/demand gen is new, they will have no clue how to work leads from those campaigns. You gave the leads to them, so you're at least partially responsible for the follow-up
Full episode at, <https://open.spotify.com/episode/16x2yos0eMino713aKfM5S?si=dD2e5LAjRi2OoUjwHcGnUw&nd=1>

<@UJG9WTEKG>, if you're looking for a podcast guest, happy to join :grin:

text:
Omnichannel strategy. Do you know what that is?

It's different from multichannel, which is just utilizing "multiple channels" (stick with me, this gets better)

Omnichannel strategy is when those channels work together to create a personalized, unified experience for customers.

A simple example is an email I'm sure you've seen before: "The items in your cart miss you!" This email is sent to you based on your activity in another channel (this company's website).

Well, omnichannel is really powerful when done right, and there's probably no one who understands it better than <https://www.linkedin.com/in/ACoAAAAIuVcBGDIMCT2aoE9NuQ1r_9FiW9QPKaI|Aaron Goldman>, CMO of <https://www.linkedin.com/company/mediaocean/|Mediaocean>.

Aaron is going to talk to me (and you!) on Tuesday 4/27 at 11am CT to teach us about how to get the best results with omnichannel marketing based on loads of data and case studies. It's sure to be a high-impact 45 minutes!

This conversation is part of Clique Elevate, a paid membership group to support upper-level marketers (VPs and directors) who aspire to C-suite roles.

The good news? You can attend this one for free! Just save your spot here: <https://lnkd.in/g2HWvZF>
